projects.title: Starazius
projects.subtitle: Arcade style top-down shooter with roguelike elements
projects.description:
My first solo developer effort.
Inspired by Star Fox, Galaga (Legions), Downwell, and bullet-hells.
The game combines elements from these inspirations for a score and achievement focussed experience.
The ambitious timeframe (~8 months) means it has quite a few rough edges, but I'm proud of it all the same.
Made in Unity with Blender, Pixelmator Pro, and FL Studio.

projects.title: Prototype 'CF'
projects.subtitle: 'Collect Frenzy' concept with single input mechanic, single screen arcade game
projects.description:
After Starazius, I wanted to try a simple abstract idea polished early to see how that might work.
There is only one input mechanic - move around the circle. The rest of the game involves collecting bits for points and to progress, and avoiding obstacles. Challenge phases were added to support awarding gems, which upon collecting all rewarded a jackpot inspired by pinball.
The controls never felt right, so I shelved the project to reuse some visual ideas later.
Made in Unity with Blender, Pixelmator Pro, and FL Studio.

projects.title: Prototype 'PS'
projects.subtitle: 'Passive Shooter' concept with focus on patterns and execution skill
projects.description:
With 'CF' shelved, I wanted to apply some of the visual design ideas in a more traditional input experience.
Again the approach was to quickly 'polish' a core experience to see how it would feel.
The game involves collecting / bumping into things of the same colour, and avoiding the opposite colour. Fill the gauge and you enter 'attack' mode where enemies fire bullets which when collected, shoot back at them.
There is a miniboss / challenge system, as well as run upgrades and bosses with more traditional bullet-hell type patterns.
This prototype felt much more fun and is one I would like to continue.
Made in Unity with Blender, Pixelmator Pro, and FL Studio.

projects.title: Travel Blog
projects.subtitle: Exploration of a custom photo album-like design for travel blogging
projects.description:
A personal passion project to get more hands-on with modern web development.
After an overseas trip with the family, I wanted a neat way to share memories. Having used other platforms in the past to do travel blogging with, I wanted to see if I could do something more unique, so used this as an opportunity to do just that.
Made using Svelte kit, hosted on GitHub static sites.
